title: Fish Movement Pattern Learning: 3D Animation-Based Cognitive Imagery Training

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational fish classification knowledge and comprehension of ecological concepts
context.additional_context: A professional development program for aquatic environment survey practitioners, focusing on cultivating field-applicable motion pattern analysis skills

learning_goals: Over 10 species' fish movement patterns can be visually identified and explained through 3D animations
Whole movement patterns can be cognitively reconstructed when only partial visual information (head/body/tail) is provided
Fish species identification accuracy improves by over 40% through analysis of real underwater video materials
Conservation strategy reports utilizing movement pattern classification systems can be created in team-based projects
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
